intro: Borreria latifolia var. sideritis, commonly known as ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite, elliptic to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. The flowers, which bloom in spring, are typically white or pale blue and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
